job_title: Admin Assistant in Saint Peter, MN
pros: I had a great supervisor. Our department had a great team.
cons: The pay is on low the low end.

review_title: Not Recommended If You Can Avoid It
job_title: Student Worker in Saint Peter, MN
pros: The job's location is on campus which is convenient for students to work, don't need to travel far for work.
cons: The pay is minimum and not a living wage. Doing a good job, doing a bad job, and not doing the job all get paid the same. Bad workers are allowed to continue working and make the workplace toxic for everyone else, as long as big waves are not made in public.

job_title: Chef in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Flexibility is the best part
cons: lower wages and less hours when other students are on break.

review_title: Wonderful Colleagues, Exhausting Work for Relatively Little Money
job_title: Professor in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Colleagues are smart, dedicated, hardworking and creative Most students are also smart, dedicated, hardworking and creative--but not all Summers to work on course preparation and research Able to select what courses to teach and when (within reason)
cons: Exhausting--committee work, special working group work, advising, mentoring, letter writing, report writing, assessment, evaluating and responding to work from students, expected to be "on" day and night, little work-life balance, and very expensive insurance options for families

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Saint Peter, MN
pros: The people and environment. No one takes themselves too seriously. Family and health come first. Good vacation time with the paid holidays. I find that the people are interesting and worldly; they’ll enjoy having a respectful conversation with you about issues and ideas. It’s easy to make friends if you’re new to the area if you’re not afraid to put yourself out there and get involved in the community.
cons: The salary is low and the health insurance and benefits are not great. Very difficult to negotiate better pay. It feels like they would rather cycle through employees every year or two instead of make their jobs attractive enough to want to stay. Lots of turnover, sometimes it’s hard to keep straight who is working where. Classic issues with higher education that I’m sure aren't just a GAC problem... frequent complaints from the top about a lack of money when funding educational projects, yet somehow there’s always plenty of cash for sports. Also, some aspects of the business are very much stuck in the 80s/90s - there seems to be a low drive to advance/improve old systems.

job_title: Career Development Specialist in Mankato, MN
pros:
A lot of creative freedom
Paid holidays, off contract time
cons: Not much room for growth

job_title: Admission Counselor in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Gustavus is an incredible institution that supports its employees with competitive pay and great benefits.
cons: Given the nature of higher education, salaries are competitive compared to other colleges, but lower compared to other industries.

review_title: It's a good job, but no long term stability
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor, Mathematics in Saint Peter, MN
pros: The students are highly motivated, you won't run into a lot of slackers or cheaters. The faculty are top notch, and a great to work with
cons: For a school that charges $60,000 per year in tuition, and the average salary for a professor is less that that, I can't figure out where the money goes. They seem more interested in expanding administration than paying faculty. Tenured faculty that retire are only replaced with temporary visitors, and the quality of the education is suffering as a result.

job_title: Office Administrator in Saint Peter, MN
pros: The College has a decent pay and benefit structure for a small liberal arts college in the Midwest. The faculty are great teachers and try very hard to help their students learn. The college has many good sports teams.
cons: The College was founded to be for the descendants of Lutheran Swedish immigrants, and they have not forgotten this. If you are not of a "certain race" and Lutheran then be prepared to assimilate big time. Look at the racial makeup of the faculty and that should tell you everything you need to know.

job_title: Librarian in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Great support from faculty and staff
cons: Liberal arts colleges in general are facing tough futures

job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Peter, MN
pros: There’s a lot of Gustavus ‘koolaid’ - people who went here and absolutely love the school, so they’re very passionate. Overall, it’s nice. The students are good overall - work hard but know how to have a bit of fun.
cons: It’s academia, like any other academic job. Departmental BS, shared governance BS, etc. What can you do.

job_title: Professor in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Colleagues are passionate and committed to students; working hard to become an equitable institution; handling COVID well.
cons: Salary lower than what other MIAC professors earn; students expect superhuman levels of commitment and time

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: fun environment and flexible schedule
cons: I cannot think of any.

job_title: Professor in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Positive culture, Good benefits, Nice community
cons: Community can sometimes be too parochial

good people to work with 
flexible scheduling

overworked as we are understaffed
poor pay

job_title: Research Student in Saint Peter, MN

job_title: Student Leader in Saint Peter, MN

Best hours and people.

review_title: not a great place to work
job_title: Custodian in Saint Peter, MN
pros: nothing really expect they have good food
cons: everything they pay everyone different at all levels not fair to anyone working doing the same job

review_title: Super fun place to work at
job_title: Marketing Consultant in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Love this place to work at!
cons: I can't think of a single con!

review_title: Alright management but could see improvement
job_title: Area Coordinator in Saint Peter, MN
pros: GAC has a very tight knit community and the administration pushes that along with the school's core values. Along with this, the students are very fun to work with and I get why they enjoy the atmosphere.
cons: Administration is not great at supporting professional staff and is consistently slow to respond to matters regarding bias which involves students. Some of it may be attributed to due process, but things are slow.

review_title: Overall okay but only for one year
job_title: Resident Assistant in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Meet new people, discounted housing, have your own room
cons: Not the best bosses, a lot of work, constantly have to be on the lookout since you're a mandated reporter

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Love working here, love the office
cons: N/A - Not available, this place is great

review_title: Student Employment at Gustavus Adolphus Collge
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Get paid by college under student employment grant
cons: They are limited in the work study allotment they can provide

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Peter, MN
pros: The hours were very reasonable and the work was enjoyable.  The people I worked with were pretty nice and the work/life balance was good.
cons: It is a little awkward to work at the college where you just graduated.  I would recommend trying to find other opportunities if you just graduated from Gustavus.  Also, the town is not near anything exciting.

job_title: Fundraiser in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Working with and for Gustavus students is a very rewarding experience. The energy they create around campus usually overshadows the complacent non-profit lifers that can keep the college in a rut.
cons: A portion of faculty, staff and administration are content to do things the way they've always been done rather than attempt to continuously improve the college. Collaboration is embraced by some employees, but certainly not a majority.

job_title: Dispatcher in Saint Peter, MN
pros:
+Can do homework while working
+People you work with are for the most part easy going and likeable
+Not a lot of supervision
+Come back to work early in the fall and move in early - beat the rush!
+Good work experience to put on resume
+Flexibility-Trading and picking up shifts is pretty easy and I've very rarely had a problem with getting somebody else to take my shift
+3.5 hrs during the week and work every other weekend (dispatch at least) = low time commitment
cons:
-Yearly trainings can be long
-Some days can be busy (think beginning of the year, emergencies)

job_title: Admissions Office Tour Guide in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Coworkers are fantastic and extremely enthusiastic. Everyone is easy to get along with and there was rarely a negative experience in the office.
cons: While there were plenty of things to do in Saint Peter, it is still a small town in rural Minnesota. Might be a difficult place to relocate to if one is used to larger cities.

job_title: Campus Safety Student Supervisor in Saint Peter, MN
pros: This is a work study job that the college provides for students who require federal aid to attend. This position allows for students to gain valuable leadership and work experience along with professional recommendations.
cons: If there are any downsides to working for the university it would be that there is little action from the bottom up. Administration is open to most any feedback from students but rarely does any action take place.

job_title: Adjunct Professor, Music in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Good colleagues, students, work situation. Adjuncts treated well, not as lower-caste. Good access to Dept. Chair and admin when needed.
cons: Adjunct lack access to percs including health ins., tuition breaks, and full-time faculty grants and travel support. Low mileage payment.

review_title: I was a student employee, so this was a great way to gain experience while having a flexible schedule.
job_title: Greenhouse Student Employee in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Flexible schedule - priority was placed on my education, and supervisors were willing to work around my classes and activities.
cons:
Low wages, but that wasn't really in my department's control (it was my student employment award from the college)
Few hours

review_title: An enriching work environment is to be found at GAC
job_title: Food Service in Saint Peter, MN
pros: Benefits to working at Gustavus are excellent managers, coworkers, and sense of community. With it being a college campus, there are always coworkers willing to help you out in a bind. Management is respectful and leads by example.
cons: No applicable cons to working at Gustavus

review_title: Great community with lots of support
